Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether mens rea is required under s. 40(1) of IRPA and whether omission constitutes a material fact
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged, but omission assessed objectively
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Omission of full-time employment at Adapana
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Requirement to disclose all employment regardless of perceived relevance
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Program Manager, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose employment history as instructed
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – court upheld reliance on application instructions
Crimes.Legal_Standard: No requirement for mens rea under s. 40(1)
Crimes.Application_Factor: Applicant believed information was immaterial but failed to disclose
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant found inadmissible due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of finding of misrepresentation under IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 40(1)(a) – definition of misrepresentation including omissions
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to disclose full-time employment at Adapana
Crimes.Document_Fraud: No allegation of forgery or falsified documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: No adverse finding; omission deemed non-intentional but still material
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that no intent = no misrepresentation rejected
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural requirements for disclosure

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose material facts under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether mens rea is required under s. 40(1)(a) and if the omission constitutes a 'material fact'
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant aware of information but chose not to disclose
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Omission of part-time then full-time employment during application
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Duty to disclose all employment per application instructions
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Program Manager, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Materiality determined by potential effect on decision process
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – decision based on completeness of application
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Misrepresentation includes innocent omissions under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Factor: Belief that employment was immaterial did not excuse non-disclosure
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant found inadmissible due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Validity of inadmissibility finding based on omission
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to disclose part-time and subsequent full-time employment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No dispute over existence of employment
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Partial credibility concern due to selective disclosure
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of lack of intent rejected by court
